description:
The US Department of Education is writing the wrongs of the University of Pennsylvania for violating Title IX sex discrimination when it forced female athletes to compete against a male swimmer who would have otherwise failed on the guys' team.

According to CNN:

The university was found to have denied “women equal opportunities by permitting males to compete in women’s intercollegiate athletics and to occupy women-only intimate facilities.”

Lia Thomas, a
title: White House goes beast mode on UPenn, demands all-female athletic records broken by men be restored

description:
Canada has decided it would not like to change anything and has voted to uphold the status quo. Today’s show gets into why Alberta should secede from Canada.

"A good portion of Canada is beyond redemption," Crowder said.

According to the recent election results, Alberta voters don’t matter when it comes to the rest of the country.

According to
title: Watch: Here's Why Canada's Election Results Are A Golden Opportunity For Trump, America & Alberta

description:
Just when you thought California lawmakers could not get any more insane, they beat everyone's expectations.

California state Senator Lola Smallwood-Cuevas introduced a bill attempting to decriminalize welfare fraud under $25,000. It’s unclear exactly who this will benefit besides the people committing the fraud, but we can almost be certain this would only incentivize more people to abuse the system if passed.

NEW: California Democrat state senator Lola Smallwood-Cuevas has introduced SB560, a bill that would decriminalize welfare fraud below an amount of $25,000. It would also prohibit prosecutions for attempted welfare fraud and would prohibit someone from being charged w/ perjury if… pic.twitter.com/nYnyfQm0vV
— Bill Me
title: California Democrat demands welfare fraud be decriminalized, calls abuse a "paperwork mistake"

description:
The Canadian elections are over and Canada has decided: we’ll take more of the same, please. We’ll explain why and take a look at what Canada has to look forward to. We’re bringing you a curated list of silliest, most ridiculous, outrageous headlines we could find recently. It’s finally here. President Donald Trump is facing articles of impeachment from Representative Shri Thanedar. Oh? You don’t know who Representative Shri Thanedar is? Well, get ready because we’re going to show you.

CARTOON CHARACTER CALLS FOR TRUMP IMPEACHMENT
title: Sources: Why Canada's Election Results Are A Golden Opportunity For Trump, America & Alberta

description:
There was a proposal to make it a felony in California to purchase 16- and 17-year-olds for sex. That proposal -- to make it a felony to purchase 16- and 17-year-olds for sex -- is being blocked by California Democrats. Apparently, if I have this right, democrats in California don't think it should be a felony to purchase 16- and 17-year-olds for sex.

I just... wow.

— (@)

So, last year, there was a senate bill (SB 1414) to make it a felony to purchase sex from ALL children (
title: CA lawmakers refuse to make it a felony to buy teens for sex and... wait, what?

description:
The theme for this week is "f*ck these people." As the massive media cover-up of Joe Biden falling apart before our very eyes (thought apparently not before the very eyes of journalismers) gets exposed -- mostly through "now it can be told" books written by journalismers -- the media insists that the blame isn't on them. They're basically trying the Eric Stratton defense: "You f*cked up. You trusted us." The latest to attempt this is Chuck Todd, with the help of Chris Cillizza.

Yesterday, we had someone getting an award for saying maybe the media should have kinda sorta done a better job. Today, it's Chuckles accusing you of virtue signaling by blaming his failing institution. The fault lies with *checks notes* Democrat leaders. Aka
title: Chuck Todd melts down over you blaming the media for covering up Biden's cognitive decline, prefers you blame someone else
